meanings.sent1: After the rain, the dry soil will reabsorb the water.
meanings.sent2: Plants can reabsorb nutrients from the soil to grow.
meanings.sent3: The sponge was so thirsty, it tried to reabsorb all the spilled juice.
meanings.sent4: The city seemed to reabsorb the chaos of the festival, returning to its usual calm.
meanings.sent5: The body's ability to reabsorb essential minerals is crucial for maintaining health.

meanings.sent1: The kidneys reabsorb water to maintain the body's balance.
meanings.sent2: The roots of the tree can reabsorb nutrients from the fallen leaves.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to reabsorb the yarn it had played with, making a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to reabsorb the anger in the room, calming everyone down.
meanings.sent5: The sponge was able to reabsorb the spilled milk, leaving no trace behind.

meanings.sent1: Neurotransmitters reabsorb into the neuron after transmitting signals.
meanings.sent2: Medication can help the brain reabsorb serotonin for better mood regulation.
meanings.sent3: The river tried to reabsorb the fish that jumped out, but they were too quick.
meanings.sent4: The artist's emotions seemed to reabsorb into the painting, giving it depth.
meanings.sent5: The sponge was designed to reabsorb any excess liquid, keeping surfaces dry.
